TITLE: Nebraska man is sentenced to prison for leaving noose for coworker
SUMMARY: Prosecutors said a 63-year-old Black man who worked for Oriental Trading found the noose made out of orange twine sitting on the seat of the equipment in June 2020

TITLE: Threats to protesters in Emmett Till rally prompt cancelation of Christmas parade in Kentucky
SUMMARY: Protesters planned a rally Saturday afternoon to call for justice for Emmett Till in Bowling Green, Kentucky where his accuser, Carolyn Bryant Donham, allegedly lives

TITLE: Mississippi man who burned cross to intimidate Black neighbors pleads guilty to hate crime
SUMMARY: Axel Cox admitted that "he burned the cross because of the victims’ race and because they were occupying a home next to his," the DOJ said

TITLE: 'Holi-Drag Storytime' for children canceled because of right-wing protesters
SUMMARY: Organizers in Columbus, Ohio, were concerned about safety as Proud Boys members and other demonstrators, some armed, gathered near the venue, a church

TITLE: Texas man charged with threatening Boston doctor who provides transgender care
SUMMARY: The threat to a doctor affiliated with a Boston LGBTQ education center comes after false information about Boston Children’s Hospital spread online, officials said

TITLE: Taylor Swift fans sue Ticketmaster following fumbled presale
SUMMARY: According to the complaint, fans are suing for damages arising from fraud and price fixing, among other alleged violations

TITLE: Broadway actor Quentin Lee dies from colon cancer at 34
SUMMARY: The actor is known for his portrayal of the phantom in the North American tour of The Phantom of the Opera

TITLE: Woman claiming to be relative of Chris Christie injures 6 deputies after getting kicked off plane, says sheriff's office
SUMMARY: Shannon Epstein, 25, was asked to leave the Spirit Airlines flight after asking a family seated near her who she allegedly believed were Latino if they were "smuggling cocaine," according to the Jefferson Parish Sheriff’s Office

TITLE: As Senate runoff nears, Herschel Walker's ex-girlfriend details abuse
SUMMARY: Cheryl Parsa, who had a five-year relationship with the football legend, says he once pressed her against a wall, grabbed her throat, and threw a punch that missed

TITLE: 'Targeted' N.C. power outages could leave more than 100, 000 in the dark for days
SUMMARY: Curfew is declared, schools closed as the FBI and state authorities join the investigation into the gun attacks on two energy substations in Moore County

TITLE: First openly transgender woman set to be executed in the U.S. asks for mercy
SUMMARY: Lawyers for Amber McLaughlin, now 49, on Monday asked Missouri Gov. Mike Parson to spare her. McLaughlin was convicted of killing 45-year-old Beverly Guenther in 2003

TITLE: Father of Texas girl allegedly killed by FedEx driver files lawsuit
SUMMARY: The suit accuses the driver, Tanner Lynn Horner, FedEx, and its subcontractor Big Topspin of negligence

TITLE: Ex-UC Irvine student threw his mother off a campus building and then jumped to his death, police say
SUMMARY: Irvine police identified the mother and son Wednesday as Thao Thai Nguyen, 77, and Andrew Nguyen Doan, 36

TITLE: Woman found dead after falling overboard from cruise ship off Florida coast
SUMMARY: A 36-year-old woman, who was not identified, was found by the Coast Guard 18 miles from the shore of Port Canaveral

TITLE: Three of the men involved in the plot to kidnap Michigan governor sentenced to prison
SUMMARY: The trial in state court was separate from a prosecution in federal court where two leaders, Adam Fox and Barry Croft Jr., were convicted of a kidnapping conspiracy

TITLE: Quinton Simon’s mother indicted on murder charges weeks after his body was found in a Georgia landfill
SUMMARY: The indictment alleges Leilani Simon, 23, caused her 20-month-old son's death with an unknown object that caused “cruel and excessive physical pain” and that she then hid his body “by discarding him in a dumpster

TITLE: House votes in favor of resolving Puerto Rico’s territorial status
SUMMARY: The Puerto Rico Status Act awaits a bleak fate in the Senate with Congress coming to an end Friday, meaning the process to make it into law will restart next year with a new Congress

TITLE: Pennsylvania school board member resigns after saying she was against voting for a 'cis, white male' for board president
SUMMARY: Jennifer Solot, who has served five years on the school board for the Upper Moreland School District, apologized for her "poorly chosen words," according to a district statement
